intro: Chenopodium cycloides, commonly known as the roundleaf goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to parts of North America, particularly in the western United States. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate to round leaves that are often hairy and have a bluish-green hue. It produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, and its seeds are encased in a hard, three-angled capsule. Chenopodium cycloides is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
